00036  * iam_lfix.c
00037  * implementation of iam format for fixed size records.
00038  *
00039  * Author: Wang Di <wangdi@clusterfs.com>
00040  * Author: Nikita Danilov <nikita@clusterfs.com>

00043 #include <linux/types.h>
00044 #include "osd_internal.h"
00045 
00046 /*
00047  * Leaf operations.
00048  */
00049 
00050 enum {
00051         IAM_LEAF_HEADER_MAGIC = 0x1976 /* This is duplicated in
00052                                         * lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00053 };
00054 
00055 /* This is duplicated in lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00056 struct iam_leaf_head {
00057         __le16 ill_magic;
00058         __le16 ill_count;
00059 };
00060 
00061 static inline int iam_lfix_entry_size(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00062 {
00063         return iam_leaf_descr(l)->id_key_size + iam_leaf_descr(l)->id_rec_size;
00064 }
00065 
00066 static inline struct iam_lentry *
00067 iam_lfix_shift(const struct iam_leaf *l, struct iam_lentry *entry, int shift)
00068 {
00069         return (void *)entry + shift * iam_lfix_entry_size(l);
00070 }
00071 
00072 static inline struct iam_key *iam_leaf_key_at(struct iam_lentry *entry)
00073 {
00074         return (struct iam_key *)entry;
00075 }
00076 
00077 static inline int lfix_keycmp(const struct iam_container *c,
00078                               const struct iam_key *k1,
00079                               const struct iam_key *k2)
00080 {
00081         return memcmp(k1, k2, c->ic_descr->id_key_size);
00082 }
00083 
00084 static struct iam_leaf_head *iam_get_head(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00085 {
00086         return (struct iam_leaf_head *)l->il_bh->b_data;
00087 }
00088 
00089 static struct iam_lentry *iam_entries(const struct buffer_head *bh)
00090 {
00091         return (void *)bh->b_data + sizeof(struct iam_leaf_head);
00092 }
00093 
00094 static struct iam_lentry *iam_get_lentries(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00095 {
00096         return iam_entries(l->il_bh);
00097 }
00098 
00099 static int leaf_count_limit(const struct iam_leaf *leaf)
00100 {
00101         int free_space;
00102 
00103         free_space = iam_leaf_container(leaf)->ic_object->i_sb->s_blocksize;
00104         free_space -= sizeof(struct iam_leaf_head);
00105         return free_space / iam_lfix_entry_size(leaf);
00106 }
00107 
00108 static int lentry_count_get(const struct iam_leaf *leaf)
00109 {
00110         return le16_to_cpu(iam_get_head(leaf)->ill_count);
00111 }
00112 
00113 static void lentry_count_set(struct iam_leaf *leaf, unsigned count)
00114 {
00115         assert_corr(0 <= count && count <= leaf_count_limit(leaf));
00116         iam_get_head(leaf)->ill_count = cpu_to_le16(count);
00117 }
00118 
00119 static struct iam_lentry *iam_lfix_get_end(const struct iam_leaf *l);
00120 
00121 #if LDISKFS_CORRECTNESS_ON || LDISKFS_INVARIANT_ON
00122 static int iam_leaf_at_rec(const struct iam_leaf *folio)
00123 {
00124         return
00125                 iam_get_lentries(folio) <= folio->il_at &&
00126                 folio->il_at < iam_lfix_get_end(folio);
00127 }
00128 #endif
00129 
00130 static struct iam_ikey *iam_lfix_ikey(const struct iam_leaf *l,
00131                                       struct iam_ikey *key)
00132 {
00133         void *ie = l->il_at;
00134         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(l));
00135         return (struct iam_ikey*)ie;
00136 }
00137 
00138 static struct iam_key *iam_lfix_key(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00139 {
00140         void *ie = l->il_at;
00141         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(l));
00142         return (struct iam_key*)ie;
00143 }
00144 
00145 static int iam_lfix_key_size(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00146 {
00147         return iam_leaf_descr(l)->id_key_size;
00148 }
00149 
00150 static void iam_lfix_start(struct iam_leaf *l)
00151 {
00152         l->il_at = iam_get_lentries(l);
00153 }
00154 
00155 static inline ptrdiff_t iam_lfix_diff(const struct iam_leaf *l,
00156                                       const struct iam_lentry *e1,
00157                                       const struct iam_lentry *e2)
00158 {
00159         ptrdiff_t diff;
00160         int esize;
00161 
00162         esize = iam_lfix_entry_size(l);
00163         diff = (void *)e1 - (void *)e2;
00164         assert_corr(diff / esize * esize == diff);
00165         return diff / esize;
00166 }
00167 
00168 static int iam_lfix_init(struct iam_leaf *l)
00169 {
00170         int result;
00171         struct iam_leaf_head *ill;
00172         int count;
00173 
00174         assert_corr(l->il_bh != NULL);
00175 
00176         ill = iam_get_head(l);
00177         count = le16_to_cpu(ill->ill_count);
00178         if (le16_to_cpu(ill->ill_magic) == IAM_LEAF_HEADER_MAGIC &&
00179             0 <= count && count <= leaf_count_limit(l)) {
00180                 l->il_at = l->il_entries = iam_get_lentries(l);
00181                 result = 0;
00182         } else {
00183                 struct inode *obj;
00184 
00185                 obj = iam_leaf_container(l)->ic_object;
00186                 CERROR("Wrong magic in node %llu (#%lu): %#x != %#x or "
00187                        "wrong count: %d (%d)\n",
00188                        (unsigned long long)l->il_bh->b_blocknr, obj->i_ino,
00189                        le16_to_cpu(ill->ill_magic), IAM_LEAF_HEADER_MAGIC,
00190                        count, leaf_count_limit(l));
00191                 result = -EIO;
00192         }
00193         return result;
00194 }
00195 
00196 static void iam_lfix_fini(struct iam_leaf *l)
00197 {
00198         l->il_entries = l->il_at = NULL;
00199 }
00200 
00201 static struct iam_lentry *iam_lfix_get_end(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00202 {
00203         int count = lentry_count_get(l);
00204         struct iam_lentry *ile = iam_lfix_shift(l, l->il_entries, count);
00205 
00206         return ile;
00207 }
00208 
00209 static struct iam_rec *iam_lfix_rec(const struct iam_leaf *l)
00210 {
00211         void *e = l->il_at;
00212         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(l));
00213         return e + iam_leaf_descr(l)->id_key_size;
00214 }
00215 
00216 static void iam_lfix_next(struct iam_leaf *l)
00217 {
00218         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(l));
00219         l->il_at = iam_lfix_shift(l, l->il_at, 1);
00220 }
00221 
00222 /*
00223  * Bug chasing.
00224  */
00225 int lfix_dump = 0;
00226 
00227 static char hdigit(char ch)
00228 {
00229         static char d[] = "0123456789abcdef";
00230         return d[ch & 0xf];
00231 }
00232 
00233 static char *hex(char ch, char *area)
00234 {
00235         area[0] = hdigit(ch >> 4);
00236         area[1] = hdigit(ch);
00237         area[2] = 0;
00238         return area;
00239 }
00240 
00241 static void l_print(struct iam_leaf *leaf, struct iam_lentry *entry)
00242 {
00243         int i;
00244         char *area;
00245         char h[3];
00246 
00247         area = (char *)entry;
00248         printk(KERN_EMERG "[");
00249         for (i = iam_lfix_key_size(leaf); i > 0; --i, ++area)
00250                 printk("%s", hex(*area, h));
00251         printk("]-(");
00252         for (i = iam_leaf_descr(leaf)->id_rec_size; i > 0; --i, ++area)
00253                 printk("%s", hex(*area, h));
00254         printk(")\n");
00255 }
00256 
00257 static void lfix_print(struct iam_leaf *leaf)
00258 {
00259         struct iam_lentry *entry;
00260         int count;
00261         int i;
00262 
00263         entry = leaf->il_entries;
00264         count = lentry_count_get(leaf);
00265         printk(KERN_EMERG "lfix: %p %p %d\n", leaf, leaf->il_at, count);
00266         for (i = 0; i < count; ++i, entry = iam_lfix_shift(leaf, entry, 1))
00267                 l_print(leaf, entry);
00268 }
00269 
00270 static int iam_lfix_lookup(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k)
00271 {
00272         struct iam_lentry *p, *q, *m, *t;
00273         struct iam_container *c;
00274         int count;
00275         int result;
00276 
00277         count = lentry_count_get(l);
00278         if (count == 0)
00279                 return IAM_LOOKUP_EMPTY;
00280 
00281         result = IAM_LOOKUP_OK;
00282         c = iam_leaf_container(l);
00283 
00284         p = l->il_entries;
00285         q = iam_lfix_shift(l, p, count - 1);
00286         if (lfix_keycmp(c, k, iam_leaf_key_at(p)) < 0) {
00287                 /*
00288                  * @k is less than the least key in the leaf
00289                  */
00290                 l->il_at = p;
00291                 result = IAM_LOOKUP_BEFORE;
00292         } else if (lfix_keycmp(c, iam_leaf_key_at(q), k) <= 0) {
00293                 l->il_at = q;
00294         } else {
00295                 /*
00296                  * EWD1293
00297                  */
00298                 while (iam_lfix_shift(l, p, 1) != q) {
00299                         m = iam_lfix_shift(l, p, iam_lfix_diff(l, q, p) / 2);
00300                         assert_corr(p < m && m < q);
00301                         if (lfix_keycmp(c, iam_leaf_key_at(m), k) <= 0)
00302                                 p = m;
00303                         else
00304                                 q = m;
00305                 }
00306                 assert_corr(lfix_keycmp(c, iam_leaf_key_at(p), k) <= 0 &&
00307                             lfix_keycmp(c, k, iam_leaf_key_at(q)) < 0);
00308                 /*
00309                  * skip over records with duplicate keys.
00310                  */
00311                 while (p > l->il_entries) {
00312                         t = iam_lfix_shift(l, p, -1);
00313                         if (lfix_keycmp(c, iam_leaf_key_at(t), k) == 0)
00314                                 p = t;
00315                         else
00316                                 break;
00317                 }
00318                 l->il_at = p;
00319         }
00320         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(l));
00321 
00322         if (lfix_keycmp(c, iam_leaf_key_at(l->il_at), k) == 0)
00323                 result = IAM_LOOKUP_EXACT;
00324 
00325         if (lfix_dump)
00326                 lfix_print(l);
00327 
00328         return result;
00329 }
00330 
00331 static int iam_lfix_ilookup(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_ikey *ik)
00332 {
00333         return iam_lfix_lookup(l, (const struct iam_key *)ik);
00334 }
00335 
00336 static void iam_lfix_key_set(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k)
00337 {
00338         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(l));
00339         memcpy(iam_leaf_key_at(l->il_at), k, iam_leaf_descr(l)->id_key_size);
00340 }
00341 
00342 static int iam_lfix_key_cmp(const struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k)
00343 {
00344         return lfix_keycmp(iam_leaf_container(l), iam_leaf_key_at(l->il_at), k);
00345 }
00346 
00347 static int iam_lfix_key_eq(const struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_key *k)
00348 {
00349         return !lfix_keycmp(iam_leaf_container(l),
00350                             iam_leaf_key_at(l->il_at), k);
00351 }
00352 
00353 static void iam_lfix_rec_set(struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_rec *r)
00354 {
00355         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(l));
00356         memcpy(iam_lfix_rec(l), r, iam_leaf_descr(l)->id_rec_size);
00357 }
00358 
00359 static inline int lfix_reccmp(const struct iam_container *c,
00360                               const struct iam_rec *r1,
00361                               const struct iam_rec *r2)
00362 {
00363         return memcmp(r1, r2, c->ic_descr->id_rec_size);
00364 }
00365 
00366 static int iam_lfix_rec_eq(const struct iam_leaf *l, const struct iam_rec *r)
00367 {
00368         return !lfix_reccmp(iam_leaf_container(l), iam_lfix_rec(l), r);
00369 }
00370 
00371 static void iam_lfix_rec_get(const struct iam_leaf *l, struct iam_rec *r)
00372 {
00373         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(l));
00374         memcpy(r, iam_lfix_rec(l), iam_leaf_descr(l)->id_rec_size);
00375 }
00376 
00377 static void iam_lfix_rec_add(struct iam_leaf *leaf,
00378                              const struct iam_key *k, const struct iam_rec *r)
00379 {
00380         struct iam_lentry *end;
00381         struct iam_lentry *cur;
00382         struct iam_lentry *start;
00383         ptrdiff_t diff;
00384         int count;
00385 
00386         assert_corr(iam_leaf_can_add(leaf, k, r));
00387 
00388         count = lentry_count_get(leaf);
00389         /*
00390          * This branch handles two exceptional cases:
00391          *
00392          *   - leaf positioned beyond last record, and
00393          *
00394          *   - empty leaf.
00395          */
00396         if (!iam_leaf_at_end(leaf)) {
00397                 end   = iam_lfix_get_end(leaf);
00398                 cur   = leaf->il_at;
00399                 if (lfix_keycmp(iam_leaf_container(leaf),
00400                                k, iam_leaf_key_at(cur)) >= 0)
00401                         iam_lfix_next(leaf);
00402                 else
00403                         /*
00404                          * Another exceptional case: insertion with the key
00405                          * less than least key in the leaf.
00406                          */
00407                         assert_corr(cur == leaf->il_entries);
00408 
00409                 start = leaf->il_at;
00410                 diff  = (void *)end - (void *)start;
00411                 assert_corr(diff >= 0);
00412                 memmove(iam_lfix_shift(leaf, start, 1), start, diff);
00413         }
00414         lentry_count_set(leaf, count + 1);
00415         iam_lfix_key_set(leaf, k);
00416         iam_lfix_rec_set(leaf, r);
00417         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(leaf));
00418 }
00419 
00420 static void iam_lfix_rec_del(struct iam_leaf *leaf, int shift)
00421 {
00422         struct iam_lentry *next, *end;
00423         int count;
00424         ptrdiff_t diff;
00425 
00426         assert_corr(iam_leaf_at_rec(leaf));
00427 
00428         count = lentry_count_get(leaf);
00429         end = iam_lfix_get_end(leaf);
00430         next = iam_lfix_shift(leaf, leaf->il_at, 1);
00431         diff = (void *)end - (void *)next;
00432         memmove(leaf->il_at, next, diff);
00433 
00434         lentry_count_set(leaf, count - 1);
00435 }
00436 
00437 static int iam_lfix_can_add(const struct iam_leaf *l,
00438                             const struct iam_key *k, const struct iam_rec *r)
00439 {
00440         return lentry_count_get(l) < leaf_count_limit(l);
00441 }
00442 
00443 static int iam_lfix_at_end(const struct iam_leaf *folio)
00444 {
00445         return folio->il_at == iam_lfix_get_end(folio);
00446 }
00447 
00448 static void iam_lfix_init_new(struct iam_container *c, struct buffer_head *bh)
00449 {
00450         struct iam_leaf_head *hdr;
00451 
00452         hdr = (struct iam_leaf_head*)bh->b_data;
00453         hdr->ill_magic = cpu_to_le16(IAM_LEAF_HEADER_MAGIC);
00454         hdr->ill_count = cpu_to_le16(0);
00455 }
00456 
00457 static void iam_lfix_split(struct iam_leaf *l, struct buffer_head **bh,
00458                            iam_ptr_t new_blknr)
00459 {
00460         struct iam_path       *path;
00461         struct iam_leaf_head  *hdr;
00462         const struct iam_ikey *pivot;
00463         struct buffer_head    *new_leaf;
00464 
00465         unsigned count;
00466         unsigned split;
00467 
00468         void *start;
00469         void *finis;
00470 
00471         new_leaf = *bh;
00472         path = iam_leaf_path(l);
00473 
00474         hdr = (void *)new_leaf->b_data;
00475 
00476         count = lentry_count_get(l);
00477         split = count / 2;
00478 
00479         start = iam_lfix_shift(l, iam_get_lentries(l), split);
00480         finis = iam_lfix_shift(l, iam_get_lentries(l), count);
00481 
00482         pivot = (const struct iam_ikey *)iam_leaf_key_at(start);
00483 
00484         memmove(iam_entries(new_leaf), start, finis - start);
00485         hdr->ill_count = cpu_to_le16(count - split);
00486         lentry_count_set(l, split);
00487         if ((void *)l->il_at >= start) {
00488                 /*
00489                  * insertion point moves into new leaf.
00490                  */
00491                 int shift;
00492                 int result;
00493 
00494                 shift = iam_lfix_diff(l, l->il_at, start);
00495                 *bh = l->il_bh;
00496                 l->il_bh = new_leaf;
00497                 l->il_curidx = new_blknr;
00498                 result = iam_lfix_init(l);
00499                 /*
00500                  * init cannot fail, as node was just initialized.
00501                  */
00502                 assert_corr(result == 0);
00503                 l->il_at = iam_lfix_shift(l, iam_get_lentries(l), shift);
00504         }
00505         /*
00506          * Insert pointer to the new node (together with the least key in
00507          * the node) into index node.
00508          */
00509         iam_insert_key_lock(path, path->ip_frame, pivot, new_blknr);
00510 }
00511 
00512 static int iam_lfix_leaf_empty(struct iam_leaf *leaf)
00513 {
00514         return lentry_count_get(leaf) == 0;
00515 }
00516 
00517 static struct iam_leaf_operations iam_lfix_leaf_ops = {
00518         .init           = iam_lfix_init,
00519         .init_new       = iam_lfix_init_new,
00520         .fini           = iam_lfix_fini,
00521         .start          = iam_lfix_start,
00522         .next           = iam_lfix_next,
00523         .key            = iam_lfix_key,
00524         .ikey           = iam_lfix_ikey,
00525         .rec            = iam_lfix_rec,
00526         .key_set        = iam_lfix_key_set,
00527         .key_cmp        = iam_lfix_key_cmp,
00528         .key_eq         = iam_lfix_key_eq,
00529         .key_size       = iam_lfix_key_size,
00530         .rec_set        = iam_lfix_rec_set,
00531         .rec_eq         = iam_lfix_rec_eq,
00532         .rec_get        = iam_lfix_rec_get,
00533         .lookup         = iam_lfix_lookup,
00534         .ilookup        = iam_lfix_ilookup,
00535         .at_end         = iam_lfix_at_end,
00536         .rec_add        = iam_lfix_rec_add,
00537         .rec_del        = iam_lfix_rec_del,
00538         .can_add        = iam_lfix_can_add,
00539         .split          = iam_lfix_split,
00540         .leaf_empty     = iam_lfix_leaf_empty,
00541 };
00542 
00543 /*
00544  * Index operations.
00545  */
00546 
00547 enum {
00548         /* This is duplicated in lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00549         /*
00550          * Then shalt thou see the dew-BEDABBLED wretch
00551          * Turn, and return, indenting with the way;
00552          * Each envious brier his weary legs doth scratch,
00553          * Each shadow makes him stop, each murmur stay:
00554          * For misery is trodden on by many,
00555          * And being low never relieved by any.
00556          */
00557         IAM_LFIX_ROOT_MAGIC = 0xbedabb1edULL // d01efull
00558 };
00559 
00560 /* This is duplicated in lustre/utils/create_iam.c */
00561 struct iam_lfix_root {
00562         __le64  ilr_magic;
00563         __le16  ilr_keysize;
00564         __le16  ilr_recsize;
00565         __le16  ilr_ptrsize;
00566         u8      ilr_indirect_levels;
00567         u8      ilr_padding;
00568 };
00569 
00570 static __u32 iam_lfix_root_ptr(struct iam_container *c)
00571 {
00572         return 0;
00573 }
00574 
00575 static int iam_lfix_node_init(struct iam_container *c, struct buffer_head *bh,
00576                               int root)
00577 {
00578         return 0;
00579 }
00580 
00581 static struct iam_entry *iam_lfix_root_inc(struct iam_container *c,
00582                                            struct iam_path *path,
00583                                            struct iam_frame *frame)
00584 {
00585         struct iam_lfix_root *root;
00586         struct iam_entry     *entries;
00587 
00588         entries = frame->entries;
00589 
00590         dx_set_count(entries, 2);
00591         assert_corr(dx_get_limit(entries) == dx_root_limit(path));
00592 
00593         root = (void *)frame->bh->b_data;
00594         assert_corr(le64_to_cpu(root->ilr_magic) == IAM_LFIX_ROOT_MAGIC);
00595         root->ilr_indirect_levels ++;
00596         frame->at = entries = iam_entry_shift(path, entries, 1);
00597         memset(iam_ikey_at(path, entries), 0,
00598                iam_path_descr(path)->id_ikey_size);
00599         return entries;
00600 }
00601 
00602 static int iam_lfix_node_check(struct iam_path *path, struct iam_frame *frame)
00603 {
00604         unsigned count;
00605         unsigned limit;
00606         unsigned limit_correct;
00607         struct iam_entry *entries;
00608 
00609         entries = dx_node_get_entries(path, frame);
00610 
00611         if (frame == path->ip_frames) {
00612                 struct iam_lfix_root *root;
00613 
00614                 root = (void *)frame->bh->b_data;
00615                 if (le64_to_cpu(root->ilr_magic) != IAM_LFIX_ROOT_MAGIC) {
00616                         return -EIO;
00617                 }
00618                 limit_correct = dx_root_limit(path);
00619         } else
00620                 limit_correct = dx_node_limit(path);
00621         count = dx_get_count(entries);
00622         limit = dx_get_limit(entries);
00623         if (count > limit) {
00624                 return -EIO;
00625         }
00626         if (limit != limit_correct) {
00627                 return -EIO;
00628         }
00629         return 0;
00630 }
00631 
00632 static int iam_lfix_node_load(struct iam_path *path, struct iam_frame *frame)
00633 {
00634         struct iam_entry *entries;
00635         void *data;
00636         entries = dx_node_get_entries(path, frame);
00637 
00638         data = frame->bh->b_data;
00639 
00640         if (frame == path->ip_frames) {
00641                 struct iam_lfix_root *root;
00642 
00643                 root = data;
00644                 path->ip_indirect = root->ilr_indirect_levels;
00645                 if (path->ip_ikey_target == NULL)
00646                         path->ip_ikey_target =
00647                                 (struct iam_ikey *)path->ip_key_target;
00648         }
00649         frame->entries = frame->at = entries;
00650         return 0;
00651 }
00652 
00653 static int iam_lfix_ikeycmp(const struct iam_container *c,
00654                             const struct iam_ikey *k1,
00655                             const struct iam_ikey *k2)
00656 {
00657         return memcmp(k1, k2, c->ic_descr->id_ikey_size);
00658 }
00659 
00660 static struct iam_path_descr *iam_lfix_ipd_alloc(const struct iam_container *c,
00661                                                  void *area)
00662 {
00663         return iam_ipd_alloc(area, c->ic_descr->id_ikey_size);
00664 }
00665 
00666 static struct iam_operations iam_lfix_ops = {
00667         .id_root_ptr    = iam_lfix_root_ptr,
00668         .id_node_read   = iam_node_read,
00669         .id_node_init   = iam_lfix_node_init,
00670         .id_node_check  = iam_lfix_node_check,
00671         .id_node_load   = iam_lfix_node_load,
00672         .id_ikeycmp     = iam_lfix_ikeycmp,
00673         .id_root_inc    = iam_lfix_root_inc,
00674         .id_ipd_alloc   = iam_lfix_ipd_alloc,
00675         .id_ipd_free    = iam_ipd_free,
00676         .id_name        = "lfix"
00677 };
00678 
00679 static int iam_lfix_guess(struct iam_container *c)
00680 {
00681         int result;
00682         struct buffer_head *bh;
00683         const struct iam_lfix_root *root;
00684 
00685         assert_corr(c->ic_object != NULL);
00686 
00687         result = iam_node_read(c, iam_lfix_root_ptr(c), NULL, &bh);
00688         if (result == 0) {
00689                 root = (void *)bh->b_data;
00690                 if (le64_to_cpu(root->ilr_magic) == IAM_LFIX_ROOT_MAGIC) {
00691                         struct iam_descr *descr;
00692 
00693                         descr = c->ic_descr;
00694                         descr->id_key_size  = le16_to_cpu(root->ilr_keysize);
00695                         descr->id_ikey_size = le16_to_cpu(root->ilr_keysize);
00696                         descr->id_rec_size  = le16_to_cpu(root->ilr_recsize);
00697                         descr->id_ptr_size  = le16_to_cpu(root->ilr_ptrsize);
00698                         descr->id_root_gap  = sizeof(struct iam_lfix_root);
00699                         descr->id_node_gap  = 0;
00700                         descr->id_ops       = &iam_lfix_ops;
00701                         descr->id_leaf_ops  = &iam_lfix_leaf_ops;
00702 
00703                         c->ic_root_bh = bh;
00704                 } else {
00705                         result = -EBADF;
00706                         brelse(bh);
00707                 }
00708         }
00709         return result;
00710 }
00711 
00712 static struct iam_format iam_lfix_format = {
00713         .if_guess = iam_lfix_guess
00714 };
00715 
00716 void iam_lfix_format_init(void)
00717 {
00718         iam_format_register(&iam_lfix_format);
00719 }
00720 
00721 /*
00722  * Debugging aid.
00723  */
00724 
00725 #define KEYSIZE (8)
00726 #define RECSIZE (8)
00727 #define PTRSIZE (4)
00728 
00729 #define LFIX_ROOT_RECNO \
00730         ((4096 - sizeof(struct iam_lfix_root)) / (KEYSIZE + PTRSIZE))
00731 
00732 #define LFIX_INDEX_RECNO (4096 / (KEYSIZE + PTRSIZE))
00733 
00734 #define LFIX_LEAF_RECNO \
00735         ((4096 - sizeof(struct iam_leaf_head)) / (KEYSIZE + RECSIZE))
00736 
00737 struct lfix_root {
00738         struct iam_lfix_root lr_root;
00739         struct {
00740                 char key[KEYSIZE];
00741                 char ptr[PTRSIZE];
00742         } lr_entry[LFIX_ROOT_RECNO];
00743 };
00744 
00745 struct lfix_index {
00746         struct dx_countlimit li_cl;
00747         char   li_padding[KEYSIZE + PTRSIZE - sizeof(struct dx_countlimit)];
00748         struct {
00749                 char key[KEYSIZE];
00750                 char ptr[PTRSIZE];
00751         } li_entry[LFIX_INDEX_RECNO - 1];
00752 };
00753 
00754 struct lfix_leaf {
00755         struct iam_leaf_head ll_head;
00756         struct {
00757                 char key[KEYSIZE];
00758                 char rec[RECSIZE];
00759         } ll_entry[LFIX_LEAF_RECNO];
00760 };
00761 
00762 #define STORE_UNALIGNED(val, dst)                       \
00763 ({                                                      \
00764         typeof(val) __val = (val);                      \
00765         CLASSERT(sizeof(val) == sizeof(*(dst)));        \
00766         memcpy(dst, &__val, sizeof(*(dst)));            \
00767 })
00768 
00769 static void lfix_root(void *buf,
00770                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00771 {
00772         struct iam_lfix_root *root;
00773         struct dx_countlimit *limit;
00774         void                 *entry;
00775 
00776         root = buf;
00777         *root = (typeof(*root)) {
00778                 .ilr_magic           = cpu_to_le64(IAM_LFIX_ROOT_MAGIC),
00779                 .ilr_keysize         = cpu_to_le16(keysize),
00780                 .ilr_recsize         = cpu_to_le16(recsize),
00781                 .ilr_ptrsize         = cpu_to_le16(ptrsize),
00782                 .ilr_indirect_levels = 0
00783         };
00784 
00785         limit = (void *)(root + 1);
00786         *limit = (typeof(*limit)){
00787                 /*
00788                  * limit itself + one pointer to the leaf.
00789                  */
00790                 .count = cpu_to_le16(2),
00791                 .limit = iam_root_limit(sizeof(struct iam_lfix_root),
00792                                         blocksize, keysize + ptrsize)
00793         };
00794 
00795         /* To guarantee that the padding "keysize + ptrsize"
00796          * covers the "dx_countlimit" and the "idle_blocks". */
00797         LASSERT((keysize + ptrsize) >=
00798                 (sizeof(struct dx_countlimit) + sizeof(__u32)));
00799 
00800         entry = (void *)(limit + 1);
00801         /* Put "idle_blocks" just after the limit. There was padding after
00802          * the limit, the "idle_blocks" re-uses part of the padding, so no
00803          * compatibility issues with old layout.
00804          */
00805         *(__u32 *)entry = 0;
00806 
00807         /*
00808          * Skip over @limit.
00809          */
00810         entry = (void *)(root + 1) + keysize + ptrsize;
00811 
00812         /*
00813          * Entry format is <key> followed by <ptr>. In the minimal tree
00814          * consisting of a root and single node, <key> is a minimal possible
00815          * key.
00816          *
00817          * XXX: this key is hard-coded to be a sequence of 0's.
00818          */
00819 
00820         memset(entry, 0, keysize);
00821         entry += keysize;
00822         /* now @entry points to <ptr> */
00823         if (ptrsize == 4)
00824                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le32(1), (u_int32_t *)entry);
00825         else
00826                 STORE_UNALIGNED(cpu_to_le64(1), (u_int64_t *)entry);
00827 }
00828 
00829 static void lfix_leaf(void *buf,
00830                       int blocksize, int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize)
00831 {
00832         struct iam_leaf_head *head;
00833         void *entry;
00834 
00835         /* form leaf */
00836         head = buf;
00837         *head = (struct iam_leaf_head) {
00838                 .ill_magic = cpu_to_le16(IAM_LEAF_HEADER_MAGIC),
00839                 /*
00840                  * Leaf contains an entry with the smallest possible key
00841                  * (created by zeroing).
00842                  */
00843                 .ill_count = cpu_to_le16(1),
00844         };
00845 
00846         entry = (void *)(head + 1);
00847         memset(entry, 0, keysize + recsize);
00848 }
00849 
00850 int iam_lfix_create(struct inode *obj,
00851                     int keysize, int ptrsize, int recsize, handle_t *handle)
00852 {
00853         struct buffer_head *root_node;
00854         struct buffer_head *leaf_node;
00855         struct super_block *sb;
00856 
00857         u32 blknr;
00858         int result = 0;
00859         unsigned long bsize;
00860 
00861         assert_corr(obj->i_size == 0);
00862 
00863         sb = obj->i_sb;
00864         bsize = sb->s_blocksize;
00865         root_node = osd_ldiskfs_append(handle, obj, &blknr);
00866         if (IS_ERR(root_node))
00867                 GOTO(out, result = PTR_ERR(root_node));
00868 
00869         leaf_node = osd_ldiskfs_append(handle, obj, &blknr);
00870         if (IS_ERR(leaf_node))
00871                 GOTO(out_root, result = PTR_ERR(leaf_node));
00872 
00873         lfix_root(root_node->b_data, bsize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00874         lfix_leaf(leaf_node->b_data, bsize, keysize, ptrsize, recsize);
00875         ldiskfs_mark_inode_dirty(handle, obj);
00876         result = ldiskfs_handle_dirty_metadata(handle, NULL, root_node);
00877         if (result == 0)
00878                 result = ldiskfs_handle_dirty_metadata(handle, NULL, leaf_node);
00879         if (result != 0)
00880                 ldiskfs_std_error(sb, result);
00881 
00882         brelse(leaf_node);
00883 
00884         GOTO(out_root, result);
00885 
00886 out_root:
00887         brelse(root_node);
00888 out:
00889         return result;
00890 }
